user_context_message_data.about_model_message:
Be terse. Speak directly.
Be thorough for open-ended or complex questions.
Avoid unprompted advice or clarifications.
Never apologize.
When unsure, say so and ask questions.
For vague prompts, ask clarifying question(s).
Think step by step.
When reasoning or predicting, you MUST add more steps.
Do NOT hedge or qualify. Do not waffle.
Use dry humor.
When sharing multiple options, be diverse.
When comparing, use multiple perspectives.
Suggest follow-up prompts for open-ended inputs.
When rewriting code, write only the changed lines.

content.text:
If you favor pleasant temperatures and minimal rainfall, October is one of the better months to visit Seoul. 【12†May】 and 【5†October】 typically offer the most agreeable circumstances. On the other hand, 【8†January】, 【14†July】, 【15†August】 and 【17†December】 tend to be characterized by conditions that may not be as optimal. 

For an in-depth look at the yearly conditions, visit our specialized 【4†Seoul climate page with graphs】.

Perfect weather is subjective. On this map perfect weather has been defined with temperatures between 20°C and 29°C and not too much precipitation (less than 90 mm a month). 

## So, what should you wear in this month?

For visitors traveling to Seoul, we recommend wearing layers. So maybe a skirt, t-shirt, shorts for during the day and jeans and a warm jacket for some days and evenings. Bring a rain jacket in case it rains during your stay. Plan on layering your clothes.

On the other hand, 【8†January】, 【14†July】, 【15†August】 and 【17†December】 tend to be characterized by conditions that may not be as optimal.

Perfect weather is subjective. On this map perfect weather has been defined with temperatures between 20°C and 29°C and not too much precipitation (less than 90 mm a month). 

## So, what should you wear in this month?

For visitors traveling to Seoul, we recommend wearing layers. So maybe a skirt, t-shirt, shorts for during the day and jeans and a warm jacket for some days and evenings. Bring a rain jacket in case it rains during your stay. Plan on layering your clothes.

content.text:
### Temperature 

A shift in the average high-temperature occurs in October, reducing from a warm 25.8°C (78.4°F) in September to a refreshing 19.8°C (67.6°F). Seoul, in October, witnesses an average low-temperature of 10.3°C (50.5°F). 

### Humidity 

In Seoul, the average relative humidity in October is 64%. 

### Rainfall

In Seoul, in October, during 6.3 rainfall days, 52mm (2.05") of precipitation is typically accumulated. Throughout the year, in Seoul, 【40†South Korea】, there are 108.8 rainfall days, and 1451mm (57.13") of precipitation is accumulated. 

### Daylight 

The average length of the day in October is 11h and 14min.  
On the first day of October, sunrise is at 06:27 and sunset at 18:15. On the last day of the month, sunrise is at 06:56 and sunset at 17:35 KST. 

### Sunshine 

The average sunshine in October is 6.4h. 

### UV index 

In October, the average daily maximum UV index is 4. A UV Index value of 3 to 5 symbolizes a medium health hazard from exposure to the Sun's UV rays for the average person.  
Note: In October, a daily maximum UV index of 4 leads to the following instructions:  
Adopt protective measures - It is advised to guard against sun damage. The Sun's most harmful UV rays are emitted around midday; avoid staying outdoors for long during this time. Prioritize a wide-brim hat for comprehensive sun defense for your face, neck, eyes, and ears.

Updated: Jul 12, 2024   
Published by: 【7†Weather Atlas】 | 【41†About Us】  
【42†Data Sources】 | 【43†Weather Forecasting & Climate】

## Frequently asked questions 

### What is the usual temperature for Seoul in October?

The high-temperature, in October, in Seoul, records 19.8°C (67.6°F), while the low-temperature is 10.3°C (50.5°F). The average heat index (a.k.a. 'real feel', 'feels like'), which factors the actual air temperature with the relative humidity, in August is computed to be 35°C (95°F).

### What is the average humidity in October?

In Seoul, the average relative humidity in October is 64%.

### How much does it rain in October?

In Seoul, in October, it is raining for 6.3 days, with typically 52mm (2.05") of accumulated precipitation.

### What is the average length of the day in October?

The average day length in October is 11h and 14min.

### When is the sunrise / sunset in October?

On the first day of October, sunrise is at 06:27 and sunset at 18:15. On the last day of the month, sunrise is at 06:56 and sunset at 17:35 KST.

### How long on average sun shines in October?

The average sunshine duration in October is 6.4h.

### What is the UV index intensity in October?

The average daily maximum UV index in October is 4. A UV Index estimate of 3 to 5 represents a moderate vulnerability from unprotected exposure to UV radiation.

parts: In early October, the weather in Seoul is cool and pleasant, with daytime highs averaging around 19-21°C (67-70°F) and nighttime lows dropping to about 9-10°C (48-50°F). It's typically dry, with light rainfall spread over 6-7 days in the month. The humidity is moderate, making it a comfortable time to explore the city【7†source】【8†source】.

metadata.title: October weather - Autumn 2024 - Seoul, South Korea
metadata.text:
### Temperature 

A shift in the average high-temperature occurs in October, reducing from a warm 25.8°C (78.4°F) in September to a refreshing 19.8°C (67.6°F). Seoul, in October, witnesses an average low-temperature of 10.3°C (50.5°F). 

### Humidity 

In Seoul, the average relative humidity in October is 64%. 

### Rainfall

In Seoul, in October, during 6.3 rainfall days, 52mm (2.05") of precipitation is typically accumulated. Throughout the year, in Seoul, 【40†South Korea】, there are 108.8 rainfall days, and 1451mm (57.13") of precipitation is accumulated. 

### Daylight 

The average length of the day in October is 11h and 14min.  
On the first day of October, sunrise is at 06:27 and sunset at 18:15. On the last day of the month, sunrise is at 06:56 and sunset at 17:35 KST. 

### Sunshine 

The average sunshine in October is 6.4h. 

### UV index 

In October, the average daily maximum UV index is 4. A UV Index value of 3 to 5 symbolizes a medium health hazard from exposure to the Sun's UV rays for the average person.  
Note: In October, a daily maximum UV index of 4 leads to the following instructions:  
Adopt protective measures - It is advised to guard against sun damage. The Sun's most harmful UV rays are emitted around midday; avoid staying outdoors for long during this time. Prioritize a wide-brim hat for comprehensive sun defense for your face, neck, eyes, and ears.

Updated: Jul 12, 2024   
Published by: 【7†Weather Atlas】 | 【41†About Us】  
【42†Data Sources】 | 【43†Weather Forecasting & Climate】

## Frequently asked questions 

### What is the usual temperature for Seoul in October?

The high-temperature, in October, in Seoul, records 19.8°C (67.6°F), while the low-temperature is 10.3°C (50.5°F). The average heat index (a.k.a. 'real feel', 'feels like'), which factors the actual air temperature with the relative humidity, in August is computed to be 35°C (95°F).

### What is the average humidity in October?

In Seoul, the average relative humidity in October is 64%.

### How much does it rain in October?

In Seoul, in October, it is raining for 6.3 days, with typically 52mm (2.05") of accumulated precipitation.

### What is the average length of the day in October?

The average day length in October is 11h and 14min.

### When is the sunrise / sunset in October?

On the first day of October, sunrise is at 06:27 and sunset at 18:15. On the last day of the month, sunrise is at 06:56 and sunset at 17:35 KST.

### How long on average sun shines in October?

The average sunshine duration in October is 6.4h.

### What is the UV index intensity in October?

The average daily maximum UV index in October is 4. A UV Index estimate of 3 to 5 represents a moderate vulnerability from unprotected exposure to UV radiation.
